definition: word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse

sentences.english: Rule out neatly any words which you don't wish Jack to read.
sentences.chinese: 把你不想让杰克看的词句整整齐齐地划掉。

sentences.english: Dialogue is the name given to any words spoken by any character, including inanimate characters.
sentences.chinese: 对话是指角色说的任何词句，包括没有生命的角色。

sentences.english: Don't underestimate how bolding certain words or sentences can make an otherwise benign statement one with emphasis.
sentences.chinese: 不要低估加粗的词句会怎样强调了本来平和的表述。

sentences.english: All the objectionable words and phrases were edited out of the manuscripts.
sentences.chinese: 所有可能引起异议的词句都从手稿中删掉了。

sentences.english: Empty verb sentences, in my analysis, are rooted in verbless constructions.
sentences.chinese: 在本文分析中，空动词句源于无动词结构。

sentences.english: Long after hope has vanished, these phantom-words remain.
sentences.chinese: 希望破灭许久之后，这些词句“阴魂不散”。

sentences.english: Words could once again flow from his mind to the page.
sentences.chinese: 心中的词句又得以倾泻于纸页之上了。

sentences.english: My mother works as an English teacher in a middle school.
sentences.chinese: 本人妈妈在一所中学当英语教师的英词句子？

sentences.english: The person might take too long to provide an answer or get words mixed up.
sentences.chinese: 这个人可能会很久才给出回答或者说的词句含混不清。

sentences.english: This seems to me only re-stating the fact in dignified language.
sentences.chinese: 由我看来，这不过是用修饰词句把事实重述罢了。

sentences.english: Generations of schoolchildren have been forced to memorise his most famous works.
sentences.chinese: 一代代学子都被要求背诵鲁迅脍炙人口的作品和词句。

sentences.english: Don't use the diffident words and sentences.
sentences.chinese: 不要常用缺乏自信的词句。

sentences.english: I could not understa goodd possibly a single sentence without a good English dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 我那时脱离字典便看脖一个英词句子。

sentences.english: A cruel word may wreck a life.
sentences.chinese: 一个残酷的词句可能折损一条生命。

sentences.english: There it clothes itself in word-masks, in metaphor-rags. In this guise it becomes horrible.
sentences.chinese: 它在这里换上面罩似的词句和破衣烂衫似的隐喻。

sentences.english: A smile from a heart can only be realised by a heart, it allows no words in between.
sentences.chinese: 会心的微笑，只能心领神会，非文章词句所能表达。

definition: word (general term including monosyllables through to short phrases)/term (e.g. technical term)/expression
vocabulary/list of words (e.g. for language teaching purposes)/word
variant of 詞彙|词汇[ci2 hui4]
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
